intro: Strychnos recognita, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody, spindle-shaped fruits that contain toxic seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in arid conditions. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
